Posts.Content: On Apr 02, 2014 11:05 PM hildeh wrote: I did the left mastectomy just because I let someone panick me into it. It was already stage IV so I declined further treatment and desided to have some fun with the time I have left. I am now 2 years down the road and have mulitple metastases in my vertebrae, so will change to a different approach. Have tried the keetogenic diet for the last year and that seemed to have no effect on slowing it down. So Now I am trying a modified Gerson diet with lots of juicing. Mostly, I just enjoy life and am greatful for each morning when I wake up. wishing you a  shiny new Moring hilde in florida We all need to make the treatment choices that are right for us. I had a left mastectomy, wanted the other gone but the surgeon would not do it. I did 8 rounds of chemo. 25 radiation treatments. I now take arimidex for 4 more years. My cancer fed off of hormones. Thats the reason for arimidex. I also stay away from soy and anything else that acts like estrogen in the body. I hope you find the thing that will slow your cancer. Just like you I enjoy life and grateful for all that I have.

Posts.Title: Breast Cancer/ with no treatment

Posts.Content: My neighbor does not have breast cancer. She has Ewing Sarcoma.She turned down any treatment. After surgery she hired a dietitian who works with her doctor. It has been three years for her and she is getting along fine. I have stage 3 breast cancer. ER positive. I chose to do the whole ball of wax. Mastectomy, chemo and radiation. I started Arimidex a year ago. This is actually a hormone blocker. My cancer feeds off of hormones. When possible I avoid soy and para bens. They act like estrogen in your body. My oncologist said to eat mostly fruit and veggies,sea food, chicken and very very little red meat. Also manmade sweeteners, I would always discuss what you want to do with your oncologist. I won't even start a new vitamin unless I ask my doc or the pharmacist.
